timeline.bodyText:
Let's rephrase a bit
The temporary directory used by the JVM must allow execution of code. Specifically,
the mount must not have the ``noexec`` flag. The default ``/tmp`` directory is
mounted with this flag in some installations, which will prevent Presto from
starting. You can workaround this by overriding the temporary directory by adding
``-Djava.io.tmpdir=/path/to/other/tmpdir`` to the list of JVM options.
